title: 108_hr5226
content: SECTION 1. CROP DISASTER ASSISTANCE. In this section, definitions are provided for terms like additional coverage, insurable commodity, and noninsurable commodity related to agricultural insurance. The Secretary of Agriculture is authorized to use funds for emergency financial assistance to producers. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide emergency financial assistance to producers on a farm who have suffered crop losses due to damaging weather conditions in 2003 or 2004. The assistance will be administered similarly to the Agriculture Appropriations Act of 2001, with the same loss thresholds. Producers will not be eligible for assistance for losses to an insurable commodity. Producers on a farm may be ineligible for assistance under this section if they did not obtain insurance for insurable commodities or file paperwork for noninsurable commodities. The Secretary can waive this requirement if producers enter into a contract with them. The Secretary may waive the insurance requirement for producers on a farm if they enter into a contract agreeing to obtain insurance for insurable commodities or file paperwork for noninsurable commodities for the next 2 crops. Violation of the contract will require the producer to reimburse the Secretary for the assistance provided. In case of a violation of a contract by a producer, they must reimburse the Secretary for the full assistance amount received. Payment limitations state that assistance for crop losses cannot exceed 95% of the crop's estimated value without losses, including any crop insurance payments received for the same crop. The assistance amount received by a producer for crop losses may be reduced by any crop insurance payments received for the same crop or the value of the crop that was not lost. Additionally, assistance under this section may be reduced by any assistance received under the Florida Disaster Programs. SEC. 2. LIVESTOCK ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide emergency financial assistance for livestock losses in designated counties for either 2003 or 2004. The assistance will be administered similarly to the American Indian livestock program. Eligibility for payments will not penalize producers. In the Agriculture Appropriations Act, 2001, the Secretary will not penalize producers in the livestock assistance program for actions taken to reduce livestock numbers due to disaster conditions. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide assistance to producers who suffered tree losses in 2003-2004 under the Tree Assistance Program. An additional $15,000,000 will be used to reimburse forest land owners for tree losses under the Emergency Conservation Program. The Secretary of Agriculture will use an additional $50,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation to assist participants in the Emergency Conservation Program. They will receive the maximum cost share percentage allowed. The Commodity Credit Corporation will be utilized to carry out this Act. Regulations will be implemented. The Secretary of Agriculture will utilize the Commodity Credit Corporation funds, facilities, and authorities to implement the Act. Regulations necessary for implementation may be promulgated without certain procedural requirements. SEC. 7. OFFSET. Amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to allocate $6,037,000,000 for fiscal years 2005 through 2014.
